studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: LY900018 (Nasal Glucagon)
arms.description: Single 3-mg dose of LY900018 administered nasally during one of the two treatment periods.

arms.name: Intramuscular Glucagon (IMG)
arms.description: Single 1-mg dose of Intramuscular Glucagon (GlucaGen) administered via IM injection during one of the two treatment periods.

studyCohorts.name: Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) Patients
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with a diagnosis of T1DM for at least 1 year on daily insulin therapy.

studyCohorts.name: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) Patients
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with a diagnosis of T2DM for at least 1 year on daily insulin therapy.

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: To demonstrate that 3 mg LY900018 is non-inferior to 1 mg IMG for the proportion of patients achievi...
objectives.text: To demonstrate that 3 mg LY900018 is non-inferior to 1 mg IMG for the proportion of patients achieving treatment success from insulin-induced hypoglycemia using a non-inferiority margin of 10%

objectives.name: To compare the safety and tolerability of 3 mg LY900018 with 1 mg IMG
objectives.text: To compare the safety and tolerability of 3 mg LY900018 with 1 mg IMG

objectives.name: To characterize the PK profile of 3 mg LY900018 compared to 1 mg IMG
objectives.text: To characterize the PK profile of 3 mg LY900018 compared to 1 mg IMG

objectives.name: To characterize the PD profile of 3 mg LY900018 compared to 1 mg IMG
objectives.text: To characterize the PD profile of 3 mg LY900018 compared to 1 mg IMG

endpoints.text: The proportion of patients achieving treatment success defined as either an increase in PG to >70 mg/dL or an increase of >20 mg/dL from nadir within 30 minutes after administration of glucagon. The nadir is defined as the minimum PG value at the time of or within 10 minutes following glucagon administration.
SAE, TEAEs (including gastrointestinal, nasal, and non-nasal AEs), vital signs
PK parameters include AUC, Cmax, Tmax
PD parameters include BGmax and Tmax

[1a] T1DM based on the World Health Organization (WHO) diagnostic criteria, and have been on the following daily insulin therapy for at least 1 year
[A] multiple daily injection of long-acting insulin analog (either insulin glargine [U-100 or U-300] or insulin degludec [U-100]) and rapid-acting insulin analog (insulin lispro, insulin aspart, or insulin glulisine), or 
[B] continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion (CSII)
Or
[1b] T2DM based on the WHO diagnostic criteria, and have received the following daily insulin therapy with or without oral anti-hyperglycemic medications (OAMs) for at least 1 year
[A] insulin: long-acting insulin analog (either insulin glargine [U-100 or U-300] or insulin degludec [U-100]) alone, or in combination with rapid-acting insulin analog (insulin lispro, insulin aspart, or insulin glulisine) or CSII
[B] OAM: up to 3 of the following OAMs in accordance with local regulations: metformin, dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitor, sodium glucose cotransporter 2 inhibitor, sulfonylurea (should not be more than half of maximum approved doses), glinides, alpha-glucosidase inhibitor, or thiazolidine

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 2
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: male patients: agree to use an effective method of contraception for the duration of the study and for 28 days following the last study treatment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 3
eligibilityCriterionItems.text:
female patients:
[3a] women of childbearing potential who are abstinent (if this is complete abstinence, as their preferred and usual lifestyle) or in a same sex relationship (as part of their preferred and usual lifestyle) must agree to either remain abstinent or stay in a same sex relationship without sexual relationships with males. Periodic abstinence (eg, calendar, ovulation, symptothermal, post-ovulation methods), declaration of abstinence just for the duration of a trial, and withdrawal are not acceptable methods of contraception. 
[3b] otherwise, women of childbearing potential participating must agree to use one highly effective method (less than 1% failure rate) of contraception, or a combination of 2 effective methods of contraception for the entirety of the study.
[A] women of childbearing potential participating must test negative for pregnancy prior to initiation of treatment as indicated by a negative serum pregnancy test at the screening visit followed by a negative urine pregnancy test within 24 hours prior to exposure.
[B] either one highly effective method of contraception or a combination of 2 effective methods of contraception will be used. The patient may choose to use a double barrier method of contraception. Barrier protection methods without concomitant use of a spermicide are not a reliable or acceptable method. Thus, each barrier method must include use of a spermicide. It should be noted that the use of male and female condoms as a double barrier method is not considered acceptable due to the high failure rate when these methods are combined.
[3c] women not of childbearing potential may participate, and include those who are:
[A] infertile due to surgical sterilization (hysterectomy, bilateral oophorectomy, or tubal ligation), congenital anomaly such as mullerian agenesis
Or
[B] postmenopausal, defined as either:
[i] a woman at least 50 years of age with an intact uterus, not on hormone therapy, who has had either:
[a] cessation of menses for at least 1 year, or
[b] at least 6 months of spontaneous amenorrhea with a follicle-stimulating hormone >40 mIU/mL; or
[ii] a woman 55 or older not on hormone therapy, who has had at least 6 months of spontaneous amenorrhea, or
[iii] a woman at least 55 years of age with a diagnosis of menopause prior to starting hormone replacement therapy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 4
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are between 18 and 64 years old for T1DM, or between 20 and 70 years old for T2DM at the time of informed consent

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 5
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a body mass index of 18.5 to 30.0 kg/m2 for T1DM, or 18.5 to 35.0 kg/m2 for T2DM at the time of screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 6
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a hemoglobin A1c value â¤10% at the time of screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 7
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have clinical laboratory test results within normal reference range (except for glycemic parameters) for the population or investigative site, or results with acceptable deviations that are judged to be not clinically significant by the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 8
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have venous access sufficient to allow for blood sampling and administration of insulin for IV administration as per the protocol

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 9
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are reliable and willing to make themselves available for the duration of the study and are willing to follow study procedures

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 10
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are able and willing to give signed informed consent

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 11
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are investigative site personnel directly affiliated with this study and their immediate families. Immediate family is defined as a spouse, biological or legal guardian, child, or sibling

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 12
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are Lilly employees

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 13
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are currently enrolled in a clinical trial involving an investigational product or any other type of medical research judged not to be scientifically or medically compatible with this study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 14
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have participated, within the last 4 months, in a clinical trial involving an investigational product. If the previous investigational product has a long half-life, 4 months or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) should have passed from the last dose of investigational product

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 15
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating LY900018, and have previously received LY900018

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 16
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have known allergies or sensitivity to LY900018, glucagon, related compounds, or any components of the formulation, or history of significant atopy

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 17
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have an abnormality in the 12-lead ECG that, in the opinion of the investigator, increases the risks associated with participating in the study

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 18
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: any significant changes in insulin regimen and/or unstable blood glucose control within the past 3 months prior to screening as assessed by the investigator

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 19
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have received a total daily dose of insulin >1.2 U/kg at the time of screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 20
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have poorly controlled hypertension (ie, supine systolic BP >165 mm Hg or supine diastolic BP >95 mm Hg) at screening, or a change in antihypertensive medications within 30 days prior to screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 21
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history of pheochromocytoma (ie, adrenal gland tumor) or insulinoma

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 22
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history of an episode of severe hypoglycemia (as defined by an episode that required third party assistance for treatment) in the 1 month prior to screening or have a history of loss of consciousness within the last 2 years induced other than by hypoglycemia

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 23
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history of epilepsy or seizure disorder

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 24
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have a history or presence of cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine (apart from T1DM or T2DM), hematological, or neurological disorders capable of significantly altering the absorption, metabolism, or elimination of drugs; of constituting a risk when taking the investigational product; or of interfering with the interpretation of data

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 25
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have known or ongoing psychiatric disorders that, in the opinion of the investigator, may preclude the patient from following and completing the protocol

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 26
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: regularly use known drugs of abuse and/or show positive findings on urinary drug screening

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 27
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and/or positive HIV antibodies and/or antigen

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 28
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of hepatitis C and/or positive hepatitis C antibody

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 29
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of hepatitis B and/or positive hepatitis B surface antigen

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 30
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: show evidence of syphilis and/or are positive for syphilis test

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 31
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: are women who are lactating

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 32
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: use of daily systemic beta-blocker, indomethacin, warfarin, anticholinergic drugs

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Criterion 33
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: have donated 400 mL or more blood in the last 12 weeks (males) or in the last 16 weeks (females), or any blood donation (including apheresis) within the last 4 weeks, or total volume of blood donation within 12 months is 1200 mL (males)/800 mL (females) or more at screening

studyInterventions.name: LY900018
studyInterventions.description: Nasal glucagon (LY900018) is a powder formulation of human glucagon for the rescue treatment of hypoglycemia.

studyInterventions.name: GlucaGen
studyInterventions.description: Intramuscular glucagon (IMG) used as an active comparator, requires reconstitution prior to administration.

studyInterventions.name: Human regular insulin
studyInterventions.description: Administered via IV infusion to induce hypoglycemia as part of the study procedure.

studyInterventions.name: Intravenous glucose
studyInterventions.description: Administered if a patient has an insufficient response to glucagon administration, loses consciousness, or experiences symptoms of severe hypoglycemia.

medicalDevices.name: Nasal Dosing Device
medicalDevices.label: Nasal Glucagon Device
medicalDevices.description: A user-friendly, single-use, nasal dosing device that delivers 3 mg glucagon powder for absorption through the nasal mucosa.

medicalDevices.name: Syringe and Needle
medicalDevices.label: Syringe/Needle
medicalDevices.description: Used for intramuscular (IM) injection of reconstituted glucagon powder.

medicalDevices.name: Bedside Glucose Monitor
medicalDevices.label: Glucometer
medicalDevices.description: Device used for bedside plasma glucose (PG) monitoring for safety.

medicalDevices.name: 12-lead Electrocardiogram Machine
medicalDevices.label: ECG Machine
medicalDevices.description: Device used to perform single and triplicate 12-lead ECGs.

medicalDevices.name: Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion Pump
medicalDevices.label: CSII Pump
medicalDevices.description: An insulin pump used for continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion as part of patients' regular therapy.

medicalDevices.name: IV Infusion System
medicalDevices.label: IV Pump
medicalDevices.description: System used for the intravenous infusion of insulin to induce hypoglycemia.

study.name: A Phase 3 Study of Nasal Glucagon (LY900018) Compared to Intramuscular Glucagon for Treatment of Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia in Japanese Patients with Diabetes Mellitus

administrations.name: Human regular insulin infusion
administrations.dose: 2 mU/kg/min, adjustable up to 3 mU/kg/min for T1DM or 4 mU/kg/min for T2DM
administrations.duration: Until bedside plasma glucose is <60 mg/dL, for a maximum of 4 hours

administrations.name: Intravenous glucose rescue
administrations.duration: As needed for insufficient response to glucagon

substances.name: glucagon
substances.description: Synthetic single-chain, 29-amino-acid polypeptide identical to human glucagon. Active ingredient in LY900018 and GlucaGen.

substances.name: human regular insulin
substances.description: Active substance used to induce hypoglycemia.

substances.name: glucose
substances.description: Active substance in the rescue medication.

commentAnnotations.text: Note to Regulatory Authorities: This document may contain protected personal data and/or commercially confidential information exempt from public disclosure. Eli Lilly and Company requests consultation regarding release/redaction prior to any public release. In the United States, this document is subject to Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Exemption 4 and may not be reproduced or otherwise disseminated without the written approval of Eli Lilly and Company or its subsidiaries.
Patients do not need to fast for samples at screening or follow-up. At Periods 1 and 2, samples should be collected from patients who have fasted at least 8 hours before any study procedures.
Serum pregnancy test will be performed at screening. Urine pregnancy test will be performed at every admission period and follow-up visit if applicable.
If an SAE occurs after signing informed consent, but prior to receiving investigational product, AND is considered reasonably possibly related to a study procedure then it MUST be reported.

Only severe hypoglycemic episodes will be reported separately as AEs. If a hypoglycemic event meets the criteria of severe, it needs to be recorded as serious in the CRF (that is, recorded as an SAE).

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Protocol Amendment (a) to protocol I8R-JE-IGBJ. The base protocol was approved on 26 October 2017.
